snippet: The companies developing the treatment, called bapineuzumab, said it did not improve cognition or daily functioning compared with a placebo.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson and Pfizer announce they are halting development of closely watched Alzheimer's drug bapineuzumab after two clinical trials failed to show that it was effective in patients with mild to moderate forms of the disease.
lead_paragraph: The companies developing the treatment, called bapineuzumab, said it did not improve cognition or daily functioning compared with a placebo.
